ClsC_c7be70b2.class_description: User-generated artifacts shared on social platforms, such as textual reactions and visual media, that form the core of online interaction.
ClsC_c7be70b2.evidence_excerpt: User-written responses to posts... Images shared by users on social media platforms as part of their content.

members.entity_description: User-written responses to posts or content on social media platforms.
members.resolution_context: The constant need for validation and approval through likes and comments can also have negative effects on mental health and self-esteem, contributing to feelings of inadequacy and comparison with others.

members.entity_description: Images shared by users on social media platforms as part of their content.
members.resolution_context: Through instant messaging, video calls, and social networking features, individuals can share updates, photos, and thoughts in real-time, fostering a sense of closeness and community among users.

ClsC_25a6c312.class_description: Groups of people acting as recipients or participants in social media communication, including broad reachable publics and individual users.
ClsC_25a6c312.evidence_excerpt: A large group of people that can be reached quickly... individuals to be more informed and engaged.

members.entity_description: A large group of people that can be reached quickly via social networking sites.
members.resolution_context: With the rise of citizen journalism and user-generated content, news spreads rapidly through social networking sites, often reaching a wider audience much faster than traditional media outlets.

members.entity_description: People using social media who become more informed and engaged in current events.
members.resolution_context: This democratization of information has empowered individuals to be more informed and engaged in current events, sparking important conversations and debates on various social issues.
